column2: With this option you can completely randomize the world in a myriad of ways
Randomize the world. Settings will be listed one day after game start.
Aztecs have a very minor chance of appearing.
Default behaviour. Crusades will be always unlocked at later bookmarks, and will unlock by events in earlier bookmarks.
Crusades/Jihad/Great Holy War will be unlocked immediately after game start. You can delay this slightly with the Crusade Delay rule.
Crusades, if unlocked, will be delayed for 1 year.
Crusades, if unlocked, will be delayed for 3 years.
Crusades, if unlocked, will be delayed for 5 years.
Crusades, if unlocked, will be delayed for 10 years.
Default Plus behaviour. Only HRE and ERE will exist as de Jure empires.
Game will start with the closest approximation possible to vanilla's de Jure empires.
Religions of the entire world will be replaced with pagan equivalents.\n§RWarning: Don't use this option in combination with New World Order. You can trigger it from NWO menu.§!
In addition to all realms being gender equal, all titles will be switched to cognatic succession
All Germans will belong to one culture initially but over time will drift apart to different cultures within the same culture group
All Germans will belong to one culture and never split apart as in vanilla CK2
All pagan religions will start the game reformed.
In first three bookmarks most of Christianity will be united under Chalcedonian faith. After that, it will be split to Catholic and Orthodox.
Chalcedonian faith will be split to Orthodox and Catholic.\n§BNote: Applicable only to first three bookmarks.§!
Catholics and Orthodox will be united under the Chalcedonian faith.
Catholics and Orthodox will be united under the Chalcedonian faith, and it will not be possible for Schism to happen.
Two Kingdom titles are required to create an empire.
Two Kingdom titles need to be completely controled to create an empire.
Three Kingdom titles are required to create an empire.
Three Kingdom titles need to be completely controled to create an empire.
